body.p:
To
Hon Thos. E Bramlette.
Governor of Kentucky
Sir

Henry S. Barnaby your petitioner would respectly represent that on the 6th day March 1865 he was fined ($500.x/100) Five hundred dollars, in the Louisville City Court, Your petitioner would further state that at the time of said trial he was unavoidably absent from the city, Had he been present he could have established the fact that he was not the owner of the "Faro Bank," He says he is not a "faro dealer." He says he believes he could have establ established these facts, which are true. He says he is a poor man, and has a family to support, He says he hopes in his case where justice and clemency seem united, you will Extend the Executive clemency to him. He prays for its remission

We the undersigned citizens of Louisville would respectfully request Your Excellency to remit so much of sd fine of $500.x/100 as is due the Commonwealth. We think this a case worthy of executive interference and clemency

Louisville
August 31. 1865
W K Thomas
James P Thornburg

Selby Harney
James R W Smith
